bullets.text: Israel resumes Gaza strikes and halts aid, accusing Hamas of truce violations, raising humanitarian and regional escalation risks.
Sanae Takaichi poised to become Japan’s first female prime minister, signaling potential policy shifts amid LDP politics and economic reform debates.
China holds benchmark lending rate steady; Asia-Pacific equities rise, reflecting cautious optimism despite slowing Chinese growth.
China’s Q3 GDP likely slowed, pressuring policymakers to balance stimulus with debt risks and bolstering global demand concerns.
Trump administration expands student loan forgiveness, potentially boosting household balance sheets and consumer spending while raising fiscal cost debates.
X’s antitrust lawsuit against Apple and OpenAI remains in Fort Worth; judge suggests parties move there, spotlighting venue strategy in Big Tech litigation.
Companies cite AI for layoffs; critics call it a convenient pretext, underscoring automation fears and labor-market restructuring narratives.
U.S. passport power drops; Americans increasingly seek second passports and golden visas, reflecting mobility, security, and tax planning concerns.
Combination therapy cuts prostate cancer mortality by 40%, suggesting early intensified treatment could significantly improve survival.
Novel cancer approach halts tumor growth while sparing healthy cells, indicating potential for more targeted, less toxic therapies.
Discovery of hidden gene could triple wheat yields, offering major gains for food security and agricultural productivity.
Miniaturized laser promises breakthroughs in imaging and sensing, enabling compact, energy-efficient devices across healthcare and consumer electronics.
Artificial sweeteners in ‘diet’ soda linked to liver damage risks, challenging assumptions about low-calorie beverages’ safety.
Abandoned land intensifies urban heat in Houston, highlighting land-use’s role in climate risk and public health.
Airliner reportedly struck by possible space debris at cruising altitude, raising concerns about orbital junk and aviation safety.
